intro: Monopsis unidentata subsp. laevicaulis, commonly known as the smoothleaf monopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in desert botany.
